intro: Lesquerella kingii var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada lesquerella, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Great Basin region of the United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces a distinctive yellowish-orange seed capsule. Lesquerella kingii var. nevadensis is valued for its potential in ecological restoration and as a source of natural oils.
